text.text: Northern Ireland | Latest News & Updates | BBC News Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK Africa Asia Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters News News N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics 'This is the most severe flu outbreak that I've experienced' - children's doctor Paediatric emergency medicine consultant Dr Julie-Ann Maney says it is a particularly virulent strain of influenza. 13 hrs ago Northern Ireland Cars banned from buzzing Belfast nightlife street Hill Street in Belfast's Cathedral Quarter will be pedestrianised for an initial six-month period. 13 hrs ago Northern Ireland Bluetongue control zone may be extended across NI, says minister Andrew Muir told Good Morning Ulster further measures may be put in place to try and stop the spread of bluetongue virus. 2 hrs ago Northern Ireland 'I can't wait to make my Northern Irish debut' - Opera star Tara Erraught The internationally acclaimed singer performs at Londonderry's St Columb's Hall on Thursday. 7 hrs ago Northern Ireland GP services in 'crisis' as one patient calls 98 times for appointment - report The PAC report says patients are experiencing significant difficulty accessing GP services in Northern Ireland. 7 hrs ago Northern Ireland 'My son is asking when his school will open again' More than 200 pupils of Nazareth House primary school in Derry are at home for a second day because of concerns over the building's roof. 2 hrs ago Northern Ireland Religious Education 'not suitable' for NI society, study suggests The QUB study aimed to find out attitudes to RE among the population in Northern Ireland. 7 hrs ago Northern Ireland Eurovision faces crucial decision over Israel Organisers of the song contest meet in Geneva on Thursday to debate Israel's role in the event. Renovation bill for Stormont canteen more than £500k The costs were revealed in a letter to North Antrim assembly member Timothy Gaston, with £20,000 still to be spent. Trust official apologises after 19-hour wait for patients in ED Dr Gareth Hampton says an increase in flu and Covid cases have put pressure on the health services in the southern trust. 'Culture of indifference towards safeguarding' at Belfast church A report has revealed that there is a "culture of indifference towards safeguarding" at Whitewell Metropolitan Tabernacle. Ombudsman identifies police failures in IRA attacks investigation The killings in Belfast were connected by one of the guns which was used. Features & Analysis 'Palliative care in NI is a Cinderella service' A widower shared his wife's story ahead of a report on access to palliative care services in NI. Gary Neville gets Queen's honorary degree The former Manchester United star turned pundit is honoured for his contribution to sport, business, education and philanthropy. 'I was emotionally bullied by some coaches, now I want to help'- ex-boxer Walsh Olympic bronze medallist Aidan Walsh on reckoning in retirement with the emotional bruises of boxing. Slow down and keep us safe, rural school pupils urge fast drivers Parents and teachers at a County Tyrone primary school call on the government to reduce the speed limit on the road outside the building over safety fears. Foyle & West Principal 'angered and saddened' by school roof safety closure The principal of Nazareth House Primary School in Londonderry says she does not know when they will be able to reopen. NI's 'worst road' fixed as new scheme aims to tackle potholes Northern Ireland's road network will become the "most understood in the world" the company behind the scheme says. At-large killer returned to prison after extradition James Meehan appeared in court in Ballymena on Tuesday after he was extradited from the Republic of Ireland. Appeal for information after man indecently exposed himself Police are asking anyone who witnessed the incident or who may be aware of similar incidents, to come forward. Listen: North West Today A round-up of local news, sport and weather across the north west of Northern Ireland. Republic of Ireland How the Irish border was created The Boundary Commission plan to adjust the border and remove places from NI was ditched in a British-Irish deal Some Irish officers to get tasers in new six-month pilot scheme The six-month scheme, set to roll out in Dublin, Waterford and Kilkenny will see about 128 officers given the stunguns. Ireland to give €125m to Ukraine as Zelensky visits Dublin The announcement was made by Taoiseach Micheál Martin at a press conference on Tuesday. World must seize this chance of peace, Zelensky tells Irish Parliament President Volodymyr Zelensky addresses the Irish parliament later on first official visit to the Republic of Ireland. TV architect Hugh Wallace dies, aged 68 Hugh Wallace, 68, was best known for presenting RTÉ's Home of the Year and the BBC's The Great House Revival More BBC News NI on iPlayer & Sounds Good Morning Ulster Wake up to Good Morning Ulster and get all the news and analysis from home and abroad. The Nolan Show Breaking news and hard-hitting talk about the big stories of the day. Talkback Highlights from Talkback. William Crawley and guests discuss the news headlines. Evening Extra All the day’s news and analysis with Richard Morgan. BBC Newsline The latest news for Northern Ireland. The State of Us Tara Mills and Declan Harvey react and reflect on news stories in a BBC NI podcast. Red Lines The back-stop’s here? Bad puns with top political coverage from BBC Northern Ireland. The View Mark Carruthers provides comment and expert analysis on the week's political news Spotlight Hard-hitting investigations on the stories that matter in Northern Ireland. Sunday Politics Northern Ireland Mark Carruthers with the latest political news, interviews and debate. Latest updates 2 hrs ago 'My son is asking when his school will open again' More than 200 pupils of Nazareth House primary school in Derry are at home for a second day because of concerns over the building's roof. 2 hrs ago 2 hrs ago Bluetongue control zone may be extended across NI, says minister Andrew Muir told Good Morning Ulster further measures may be put in place to try and stop the spread of bluetongue virus. 2 hrs ago 7 hrs ago 'I can't wait to make my Northern Irish debut' - Opera star Tara Erraught The internationally acclaimed singer performs at Londonderry's St Columb's Hall on Thursday. 7 hrs ago 7 hrs ago Religious Education 'not suitable' for NI society, study suggests The QUB study aimed to find out attitudes to RE among the population in Northern Ireland. 7 hrs ago 7 hrs ago GP services in 'crisis' as one patient calls 98 times for appointment - report The PAC report says patients are experiencing significant difficulty accessing GP services in Northern Ireland. 7 hrs ago 13 hrs ago Cars banned from buzzing Belfast nightlife street Hill Street in Belfast's Cathedral Quarter will be pedestrianised for an initial six-month period. 13 hrs ago 13 hrs ago 'This is the most severe flu outbreak that I've experienced' - children's doctor Paediatric emergency medicine consultant Dr Julie-Ann Maney says it is a particularly virulent strain of influenza. 13 hrs ago 16 hrs ago More than 40 suspected cases of bluetongue virus in NI A 20km temporary control zone was put in place by The Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs on Saturday. 16 hrs ago 17 hrs ago 'I knew my body and mind were shutting down,' detective tells court after PSNI data breach Belfast High Court has heard how a PSNI detective feared he would be targeted following the major data breach in 2023. 17 hrs ago ... Trust official apologises after 19-hour wait for patients in ED Dr Gareth Hampton says an increase in flu and Covid cases have put pressure on the health services in the southern trust. Slow down and keep us safe, rural school pupils urge fast drivers Parents and teachers at a County Tyrone primary school call on the government to reduce the speed limit on the road outside the building over safety fears.
